channel.title: How much could i get in trouble?
channel.description: If i have a allstarscape 317 24/7, what would be the baddest thing that could happen if Jagex finds my server?

item.title: How much could i get in trouble?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Why did you bump this? Its already been answered.
If Jagex targets you they will ask you to shut everything down. If you refuse they will take legal actions against you. There is a very small chance that Jagex will target you though. What more could you possibly need to know that hasn’t already been posted?

Read full topic
item.source: How much could i get in trouble?

item.title: How much could i get in trouble?
item.dc:creator: @bily123 bily123
item.description:
@bily123 wrote:

Yeah while downloading a source there was a comment by Jagex.ltd stating what will happen.
Jagex will ask you to shutdown your server and remove any downloaded link of it. They state if it is not removed legal actions will be taken.

Read full topic

item.source: How much could i get in trouble?

item.title: How much could i get in trouble?
item.dc:creator: @starting_coder starting coder
item.description:
@starting_coder wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=449959.msg3300758#msg3300758 date=1281291534]

EDIT: Also, the servers are LEGAL. The server has been programmed from scatch out of ones own knowledge all it does is send and recieve messages from the client, and iirc Jagex dropped the copyright laws on the 317 client because they’re old and they updated to the 400+'s.

Wrong.

JaGeX still owns a copyright on the 317 protocol, client, and cache.

Updated my post.

Well, I dont think you remember correctly. All client revisions are protected under copyright laws.

You must not reverse-engineer, decompile or modify any Jagex Product client software in any way

Oh, so if i make an 317 now, it’s just legal?

No -.-

Heh, I was wrong. But still, they wont do nothing if you’re not acquiring any source of income / profit from it. If they was going to do something, don’t you think Moparscape would be shut down by now?

They have tried.

The Servers are legal, they are 100% Java, making them not illegal.

You have to be joking, programs that I or others write on our own (for example SCAR) are 100% our code and they can be used for a multitude of purposes

The Servers are simply just (For example, on a 317) A ServerSocket waiting for connections from A client… This could be used for many different purposes. There is nothing illegal with the Server.
[/quote]
Using the original JaGeX packets/streaming methods, the server is considered intellectual property.

Unless the user has replaced the stream class with Blake’s RSBuffer the server is still theirs.[/quote]

Epic Quote!

Read full topic
item.source: How much could i get in trouble?

Read full topic

item.title: How much could i get in trouble?
item.dc:creator: @someone2 someone2
item.description:
@someone2 wrote:

Will Jagex shut my server down if i don’t have a website, i won’t earn any money, and i will only advertise on Run3-s3rv3r, and i don’t think i will get more then 10 players…

Read full topic
item.source: How much could i get in trouble?

item.title: How much could i get in trouble?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

jagex can’t shut you down for a server, they have no proof that your using the Stream and Cryption Classes from the original 317 server ripped from a Deob. If you host a web client, client, or anything related to a client, a website that uses there website template, images, etc. You can say that the server is for education and they can’t do anything about the server because of a claws in the DMCA (I am pretty sure?).

Read full topic
item.source: How much could i get in trouble?

item.title: How much could i get in trouble?
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Natey link=topic=449959.msg3300859#msg3300859 date=1281294999]
JaGeX owns anything related to RS that was produced and programmed by them, they don’t really care as long as you’re not making profits from it, because that’s basically stealing money from them.
I mean if you had like a bot along with the server that was used for RS, then yeah they’d come after you, I’ve seen and played many allstar-scape bases and they where hosted 2+ weeks and JaGeX never came after them, so you really have nothing to worry about as long as it’s for "learning experiences " and non-profitable.
[/quote]I don’t believe two weeks in long enough for JaGeX to discover the server.

JaGeX usually goes for the top servers first.
The ones that have their own websites, dedi’s, and massive player amount.

Also, JaGeX doesn’t just care about the profits.
They also care for the player base to which they are losing/have lost.[/quote]Yes, but I had a allstar-scape server which I had fixed up a tad bit, had about 65 players on daily, after a while JaGeX contacted me via my websites email and asked me to take my donation banner down, didn’t try to shut me down, and yes they do go after the big servers with huge player amounts, doesn’t mean they will always get shut down, look at battlescape

Read full topic
item.source: How much could i get in trouble?

item.title: How much could i get in trouble?
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

JaGeX owns anything related to RS that was produced and programmed by them, they don’t really care as long as you’re not making profits from it, because that’s basically stealing money from them.
I mean if you had like a bot along with the server that was used for RS, then yeah they’d come after you, I’ve seen and played many allstar-scape bases and they where hosted 2+ weeks and JaGeX never came after them, so you really have nothing to worry about as long as it’s for "learning experiences " and non-profitable.

Read full topic
item.source: How much could i get in trouble?

item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Wanna know how to make a client legal?
Recode it so the files are named differently -.- Such as, instead of class1.java/class, name it file1.java/class. and recode everything that way :]

Read full topic

item.title: How much could i get in trouble?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=449959.msg3300695#msg3300695 date=1281289773]
EDIT: Also, the servers are LEGAL. The server has been programmed from scatch out of ones own knowledge all it does is send and recieve messages from the client, and iirc Jagex dropped the copyright laws on the 317 client because they’re old and they updated to the 400+'s.
[/quote]
Wrong.

JaGeX still owns a copyright on the 317 protocol, client, and cache.

Updated my post.

Well, I dont think you remember correctly. All client revisions are protected under copyright laws.

You must not reverse-engineer, decompile or modify any Jagex Product client software in any way

Oh, so if i make an 317 now, it’s just legal?

No -.-

Heh, I was wrong. But still, they wont do nothing if you’re not acquiring any source of income / profit from it. If they was going to do something, don’t you think Moparscape would be shut down by now?

They have tried.[/quote]

The Servers are legal, they are 100% Java, making them not illegal.

You have to be joking, programs that I or others write on our own (for example SCAR) are 100% our code and they can be used for a multitude of purposes

The Servers are simply just (For example, on a 317) A ServerSocket waiting for connections from A client… This could be used for many different purposes. There is nothing illegal with the Server.

Read full topic
item.source: How much could i get in trouble?

item.title: How much could i get in trouble?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:13, topic:353649”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=449959.msg3300727#msg3300727 date=1281290506]

Updated my post.

Well, I dont think you remember correctly. All client revisions are protected under copyright laws.

You must not reverse-engineer, decompile or modify any Jagex Product client software in any way

Oh, so if i make an 317 now, it’s just legal?

No -.-

Heh, I was wrong. But still, they wont do nothing if you’re not acquiring any source of income / profit from it. If they was going to do something, don’t you think Moparscape would be shut down by now?
[/quote]
Mopar knows how to fight.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/lawstuff[/quote]
Still, I really, really don’t think Jagex would do anything.

RuneScape Private Servers Illegal?

Why would Jagex care when the servers can give them massive laughs cus they are so bad?

Also, like I said, the Client is the only bit that could be illegal as the Server is 100% legal. So therefore I conclude that I personally think that… Nothing at all will ever happen if you are hosting a private server as long as you’re not gaining from it, EG; Profit.

Read full topic
